thread.title: ZIIP Halo Nanocurrent & Microcurrent Facial Toning Device: The ultimate at-home anti-ageing tool for glowing, sculpted skin
thread.title_full: ZIIP Halo Nanocurrent & Microcurrent Facial Toning Device: The ultimate at-home anti-ageing tool for glowing, sculpted skin

author: Olivia Scott
title: ZIIP Halo Nanocurrent & Microcurrent Facial Toning Device: The ultimate at-home anti-ageing tool for glowing, sculpted skin
text:
My social media feed is constantly inundated with the latest beauty tools and devices and while some seem like passing trends, the ZIIP Halo Nanocurrent and Microcurrent Facial Toning Device from CurrentBody caught my eye.
I already own CurrentBody’s LED Mask and absolutely love it — and I have seen visible results after using it consistently.
So, when I saw what the ZIIP Halo was capable of and read many glowing reviews like the one from Nadia Bartel, I knew I had to try it.
Know the news with the 7NEWS app: Download today
The ZIIP Halo retails for $675 and is the only skin technology that fuses microcurrent and nanocurrent to achieve both instant and long-lasting results.
It literally gives you an automatic facial at home, together, microcurrent and nanocurrent work in harmony for immediate and long-lasting results.
Nadia Bartel is also a fan of the ZIIP Halo device. Credit: TikTok
A user’s before and after using the skin toning device. Credit: Instagram The device treats a range of skin concerns including wrinkles, sagging skin, blemishes, pigmentation and dull texture.
If you’ve ever used a Gua Sha before, the ZIIP Halo is similar but a much more advanced and effective version of one.
The device stimulates collagen while giving your skin a lift with its 4-minute freeform facial.
The ZIIP Halo comes with its Electric Complex Gel, a USB-C charging cable and a user manual explaining how it works.
The device stimulates collagen while giving your skin a lift with its four-minute freeform facial. Credit: Instagram The ZIIP Halo also comes with a free downloadable app that features different facials and treatment guides that you can try with your device.
For best results, CurrentBody recommends that you use your ZIIP 3-5 times per week with a maximum of 6 times per week when following a short treatment plan.
I personally love the results I am seeing using my ZIIP Halo, while I have only been trialling it for a short period of time, I have already noticed more of a glow in my skin as well as my face feeling more sculpted.
You can also purchase a range of other gels that can be used in conjunction with your device including a Golden Gel, a Silver Gel and a Crystal Gel.
ZIIP Gels are highly powerful microcurrent conductive gels that are essential when preparing your face to use your ZIIP.
The gels are designed to work in harmony with Microcurrent and Nanocurrent facial treatments to protect the skin whilst enabling waveforms to pass effortlessly from your ZIIP device through the skin.
The Golden Gel retails for $209 and is best for those wanting an extra collagen boost, the Crystal Gel retails for $119 and is best for those wanting a glow boost and lastly the Silver Gel which will give you a boost of hydration also retails for $119.
Shoppers are also obsessed with the ZIIP Halo and have given the device a 4.7-star rating on its website.
“I absolutely love ZIIP Halo. It does what no other microcurrent device does. It lifts and stimulates to give a radiant glow,” one person said.
“ZIIP is the best skincare device I ever purchased,” another shopper added.
“The difference in my skin is apparent after each treatment. The ZIIP Halo has significantly lifted my entire face, specifically my eye area, where others have noticed. I am extremely impressed,” a third person commented.
To purchase the ZIIP Halo, head to the ZIIP Beauty website here.
